## geom-closest-point package

## Variables

|  Variable | Description |
|  --- | --- |

|  [closestPointArray](./geom-closest-point.closestpointarray.md) |  |
|  [closestPointCircle](./geom-closest-point.closestpointcircle.md) |  |
|  [closestPointLine](./geom-closest-point.closestpointline.md) | Returns closest point to <code>p</code> on infinite line defined by points <code>a</code> and <code>b</code>. Use [closestPointSegment](./geom-closest-point.closestpointsegment.md) to only consider the actual line segment between these two points.[closestPointSegment](./geom-closest-point.closestpointsegment.md) |
|  [closestPointPlane](./geom-closest-point.closestpointplane.md) |  |
|  [closestPointPolyline](./geom-closest-point.closestpointpolyline.md) |  |
|  [closestPointRect](./geom-closest-point.closestpointrect.md) |  |
|  [closestPointSegment](./geom-closest-point.closestpointsegment.md) | Returns closest point to <code>p</code> on line segment <code>a</code> -<!-- -->&gt; <code>b</code>. By default, if the result point lies outside the segment, returns a copy of the closest end point. The result is written to the optional <code>out</code> vector (or if omitted, a new one is created).<!-- -->If <code>insideOnly</code> is true, only returns the closest point iff it actually is inside the segment. The behavior of this configurable via the optional <code>eps</code> arg and by default includes both end points. This function uses [closestT](./geom-closest-point.closestt.md) to compute the parametric position of the result point and determine if it lies within the line segment. If <code>eps &gt; 0</code>, the end points <code>a</code> and <code>b</code> will be excluded from the match, effectively shortening the valid line segment from both ends, i.e. the valid interval of the parametric position will be \[eps,1-eps\]. If the result lies outside this interval, the function returns <code>undefined</code>. Likewise, if <code>a</code> and <code>b</code> are coincident. |
|  [closestPointSphere](./geom-closest-point.closestpointsphere.md) |  |
|  [closestT](./geom-closest-point.closestt.md) | Computes the parametric distance <code>t</code> of point <code>p</code> projected onto line <code>a</code> -<!-- -->&gt; <code>b</code>, relative to <code>a</code>. I.e. the projection of <code>p</code> can then be computed like so: |
|  [distToLine](./geom-closest-point.disttoline.md) | Returns distance from <code>p</code> to closest point to infinite line <code>a</code> -<!-- -->&gt; <code>b</code>. Use [distToSegment](./geom-closest-point.disttosegment.md) to only consider the actual line segment between these two points.[distToSegment](./geom-closest-point.disttosegment.md) |
|  [distToPlane](./geom-closest-point.disttoplane.md) |  |
|  [distToSegment](./geom-closest-point.disttosegment.md) | Returns distance from <code>p</code> to closest point on line segment <code>a</code> -<!-- -->&gt; <code>b</code>. |
|  [farthestPointSegment](./geom-closest-point.farthestpointsegment.md) | Returns the index of the start point containing the segment in the polyline array <code>points</code> farthest away from <code>p</code> with regards to the line segment <code>a</code> to <code>b</code>. <code>points</code> is only checked between indices <code>from</code> and <code>to</code> (not including the latter). |
